#Text=Wikinews interviews former Congressman Virgil Goode , Constitution Party presidential candidate
#Text=Monday , February 27 , 2012
#Text=Official congressional photo of Goode .
#Text=Former Congressman Virgil Goode of Virginia spoke with Wikinews reporter William S. Saturn about his newly announced 2012 presidential campaign .
#Text=Goode is currently seeking the nomination of the Constitution Party , a U.S. third party .
#Text=Goode served in the Virginia State Senate for twenty-three years .
#Text=In 1996 , he was elected to represent Virginia 's Fifth U.S. congressional district as a Democrat , and was re-elected two years later .
#Text=Goode left the Democratic Party before his second re-election campaign in 2000 , and ran as an Independent .
#Text=He joined the Republican Party ahead of the 2002 election , and was re-elected three additional times until his defeat in 2008 .
#Text=Since then , Goode has joined the Constitution Party , and has served on its executive committee .
#Text=The Constitution Party was founded in 1991 as the U.S. Taxpayers Party .
#Text=Eight years later , it changed to its current name .
#Text=The party advocates states ' rights , gun rights , limited government , protectionism , and non-interventionism .
#Text=It strongly opposes abortion and illegal immigration .
#Text=In terms of voter registration , it is the third largest U.S. political party with 367,000 members .
#Text=Pastor Chuck Baldwin won the party 's 2008 presidential nomination , and appeared on 37 state ballots receiving 199,314 votes ( 0.15 % ) .
#Text=Goode had been speculated to make a run for the party 's presidential nomination since last year .
#Text=In fact , the executive committee passed a resolution last spring to convince him to run .
#Text=Goode filed paperwork with the Federal Election Commission ( FEC ) on February 10 , and announced his candidacy to the Daily Caller six days later .
#Text=The 2012 Constitution Party National Convention will be held in April .
#Text=Other candidates seeking the nomination include former Savannah State football coach Robby Wells .
#Text=National chairman Jim Clymer described Goode last summer as the frontrunner for the party 's nomination .
#Text=To Wikinews , Goode affirmed his credentials for the presidency and shared his view on the Obama administration .
#Text=Among other issues , he addressed immigration , spending , energy , and foreign policy .
#Text=Interview
#Text=First , I ’d like to get some background .
#Text=What are your proudest political accomplishments ?
#Text=I served in the Virginia State Senate from December 1973 to January 1997 .
#Text=23 years .
#Text=Then I was in the United States House of Representatives from January 1997 to January 2009 .
#Text=What exactly did you do during those years ?
#Text=Well , in the Virginia Senate , I served on a number of different committees , and became familiar with the operation of the Virginia State government .
#Text=And then the U.S. House of Representatives where I served twelve years , I became familiar with the operation of the federal government .
#Text=I was on the Appropriations Committee for several congresses , and that helped with the understanding of the budget and the need that we have to make a serious cut in order to achieve balance .
